page.title: 07Religion in Crockenhill
page.content: Crockenhill is unusual in that the the Baptist Chapel was established before the Anglican church. The Baptist Chapel was set up in 1801 in a blacksmith's premises in the present Old Chapel Road and then moved to Eynsford Road in 1870.A school was opened alongside and was the fore runner of the Council School that was opened in 1906.The Anglican Church was opened in 1852 and the building was designed by Nash believed to have been related to the Nash who helped with the design of Buckingham Palace.The old wealthy families tended to support the Union Chapel but in the last 30 years many have left.Today about 40 people attend and the Boys Brigade has about 20 members.The Anglican Church has about 50 members some of which live outside the village but is usually full for the main festivals.
